name: Demazure conjecture
rephrased: The conjecture states that the Demazure character formula, which describes characters of certain representations, holds generally for representations of algebraic groups over fields of characteristic zero, allowing extensions beyond complex representations.
implication_form: If the representation is of an algebraic group over a field of characteristic zero, then the Demazure character formula applies.
explained: The Demazure conjecture, now a proven theorem, asserts that the Demazure character formula holds for representations of complex semisimple algebraic groups (or their associated flag varieties) over any field of characteristic zero. More precisely, it states that the character of a certain representation (constructed via Demazure operators) coincides with the character given by a specific formula involving the root system and the Weyl group, and this formula remains valid regardless of the specific field (e.g., complex numbers, p-adic fields, etc.) as long as the characteristic is zero.
related_conjectures: Conjectures related to extending the results to positive characteristic (though this is generally more difficult and not fully achieved in all cases), conjectures concerning integral forms or representations over the integers
Conjectures about generalizations to Kac-Moody algebras or affine groups (e.g., in the context of geometric crystals or the affine Demazure conjecture)
Conjectures related to the BGG resolution or Koszul duality
